In baseball, base running is the act of running around the bases performed by 
members of the team at bat. In general, base running is a tactical part of the game 
with the goal of eventually reaching home to score a run. The goal of batting is 
generally to produce base runners, or help move base ... For any base running to 
occur, a batter must initially become a base runner.
